pure function reverse_string(s) result(rev_str)
    character(len=*), intent(in) :: s
    character(len=len_trim(s)) :: rev_str
    integer :: i, l
    l = len_trim(s) rev_str = ' ' do i = 1, l
        rev_str(i:i) = s(l - i + 1:len_trim(s))
    end do
end function reverse_string

function reverse_string(s_in) result(s_out)

character(len=*), intent(in) :: s_in

character(len=len(s_in)) :: s_out

integer :: i, len_s

len_s = len_trim(s_in)

s_out = ' ' * len_s

do i =1, len_s

   s_out(i: i) = s_in(len_s -i +1:len_s -i +1)

end do

end function

program codeforces_350_B

implicit none

integer :: n, i, x, s, ans =0

integer, dimension(:), allocatable :: a, b, num, path_array

logical, dimension(:), allocatable :: st

contains

    ! Subroutine to reverse string

    character(len=*), intent(IN) :: s_in

    character(len(len_trim(s_in))) function reverse_string(s_in) result(rev_str)

        character(len=*), intent(in) :: s_in
        character(len=len_trim(s_in)) :: rev_str
        integer :: l, i
        l = len_trim(s_in) do i =1, l
            rev_str(i:i) = s_in(l -i +1:l -i +1)
        end do
    reverse_str = rev_str
    end function reverse_string

end contains

Function to reverse a string in Fortran:

pure function reverse_string(s) result(rev_str)
    character(len=*), intent(in) :: s
    character(len=len_trim(s)) :: rev_str
    integer :: i, l
    l = len_trim(s)
    rev_str = ' '
    do i = 1, l
        rev_str(i:i) = s(l - i + 1:len_trim(s))
    end do
end function reverse_string

            character(len=20) :: current_i_str
